website_summaries.verdict: Although not as versatile as some other absorbent socks on our list, they are perfect for smaller tasks and various uses around the house.
pros: Easy to work with and ideal for smaller moisture-absorbing tasks, thanks to the 34 by 4-inch size that's shorter and wider than standard socks
Sturdy materials can absorb up to 10 times their weight
Perfect for window condensation and door drafts
cons: Rare reports of customers receiving one sock instead of three
Not ideal for major spills or messes, or cleaning up oil

customer_reviews.title: After going through countless towels to soak up the water I remembered these were good for absorbing water too
customer_reviews.text: Total lifesaver! I bought these initially to help with a very drafty window. They worked well for that. A few weeks later we ended up with a leaky pipe in the laundry room. After going through countless towels to soak up the water I remembered these were good for absorbing water too. I can't believe how much water they soaked up. These saved me a ton of time cleaning up the water. Once the pipe was fixed I laid these outside to dry for a few hours and put them back on the drafty window. Definitely got my money's worth with these!
customer_reviews.author: xxmissvxx

customer_reviews.title: works well for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: These are kind of like long cylindrical bean bags. I actually got them to close a small gap under my navy blackout curtains and they work well for that purpose. My only complaint is that they were incredibly dirty/dusty when they arrived, such that I had to take them outside and shake them out pretty extensively. Looked pretty good afterwards though.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great for absorbing moisture in window sills
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my Mother, she has a corner bedroom with 2 windows that always have condensation. She has had to replace window sills and plaster around windows several times because of constant moisture causing mold and even breakdown of mortar in the outside bricks. I put these is the windows and they absorb all the moisture before it has a chance to seep into walls. They are wonderful. She says she wishes she had these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: JoDeeps

customer_reviews.title: Very small
customer_reviews.text: This particular size is small and would be great for window ledges. For my purpose it is way too small. It does a great job of absorbing water. Will be ordering the much larger size. If you need for small spaces this would be great.
customer_reviews.author: kassie mae

customer_reviews.title: Not better than using an old towel
customer_reviews.text: These seem to work ok but they don’t look much if any better than rolling up a thin towel across the bottom of the window and I think a towel works just as well, maybe better. I’ll use an old towel instead of ordering more
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Great for toilet/tank sweat...
customer_reviews.text: These water-absorbers are great and work really well for small leaks, window-sills, and sweat around the toilet. The only thing that would make them better, would be a braided-cord handle at one end so you can hang them to dry. They must be vertical to drip-dry if you want to re-use them.
customer_reviews.author: StormKat

customer_reviews.title: Low Capacity
customer_reviews.text: During heavy rains it is typical for some water to leak into my basement. In an attempt to contain the water and avoid having to bring out the mop bucket, I opted for laying down these snakes. At least I know now that these products are a waste of time. They did absorb about a cup of water. After that point water trickled out of them and continued onto the basement floor as pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy C. Kretschmer

customer_reviews.title: Reusable!!
customer_reviews.text: very effective! 2nd purchase, going to get a few more for when we get water seepage in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Barone

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good product that actually soaks up lots of water and it is well designed.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Why is my snake so hard?
customer_reviews.text: Very good at soaking up water. Took a very long time-days -to dry, and the material solidified.
customer_reviews.author: mtwrdsmth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These certainly do the job of stopping air coming in windows. Will order a few more. Thank you

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for the opportunity to tell others about this wonderful, inexpensive, lightweight absorbing and draft blocking snake. I think that about covers the whole review.
customer_reviews.author: PHD

customer_reviews.title: excellent..
customer_reviews.text: excellent...no issues with this product yet...have been using it for about 2 months...no more water on the floor after showers...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product does its job
customer_reviews.text: Great product for water issue and can dry outside and reuse
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I liked how it seals the gap but I disliked that it looses the stuffing all over the place when it is dry.
customer_reviews.author: Eleonora

customer_reviews.title: Practical thing to have ready in the house
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning out the filter of a washing machine was Always a mess, until this great absorber came around. Evenly important is that it"s reusable after air drying.
customer_reviews.author: Deleffe

customer_reviews.title: Snakes work
customer_reviews.text: It soaked up great but started turning brown shortly after .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for several months in my basement, and they have almost totally deteriorated. I don't know where the "stuffing" has gone, there are no tears or holes in the fabric. They also produce long, ugly mold tendrils when wet. Won't buy or use them again.
customer_reviews.author: Junesix44

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: We use these on windowsills in our basement. During very heavy, windy rains some water will seep through...the snakes soak it right up before it can do any damage.
customer_reviews.author: TomK1111

customer_reviews.title: Beware of allergies
customer_reviews.text: I loved it in the beginning but found over time that the sawdust was coming out all over everything and causing allergies.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: once it gets wet, the water sits on the surface and the porch floor got wt also.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would absorb the water better and stay dry and I could leave it instead of towels. I wasted my money as it's no better than the towels I already own.
customer_reviews.author: Alina C. Otal

product_meta.title: Window Condensation Moisture Absorber Water Snake -Water Barrier & Draft Stopper (Regular Set of 3)
product_meta.description: Size:Regular| Color:Set of 3Soak Up Condensation on Windows. Water Snake soaks up window condensation that can ruin your wood sills. This unique product soaks up 1000% of its weight in water, so you can also use it near your tub to soak up the excess water on the floor. Made of natural materials, and can also be used at the bottom of doors to stop drafts.
feature_bullets: Super absorbent, it's able to hold up to ten times its weight in water
Great in a crisis - quickly soaks up water from leaks and storms
Prevents water damage from condensation along windowsills
Also excellent for stopping drafts under doors and old windows

specifications.Material: Fabric cover with dried corn cob filling
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars38 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
